p: Nowadays, intensive research is underway on plant-derived mucilage-based edible coatings and films to enhance the shelf life of fruits, vegetables, meats, and fish products. Similarly, mucilage is being used to develop nanofibers, which creates a large market for the textile industry in fabrication. The hydrophilic nature of mucus can act as a barrier to water penetration, delaying water loss and prolonging firmness [ 144]. This property makes it a promising component for cosmetic industry applications. Therefore, it is to be expected that, in the coming years, the slime market will include a wide range of applications and new market development.
